intro: Duperrea pavettifolia var. kontumensis, commonly known as the Kontum duperrea, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Vietnam. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in dense forests or along stream banks. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
